oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Two snapshots of American soldiers playing cards and smoking
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Two snapshots of American soldiers playing cards and smoking. One of the soldiers in the photograph may be Lt. John Barksdale Greer, 117th MG Battn., 31st Div. Greer was from Loudon, Tennessee. Greer kept a playing card and a poker chip as a momento. See [Gwmary 071]. The second image shows four men smoking with two bottles in front of them. Three of the men appear to have Georgia state seals on their hats which may indicate that they are cadets at the Georgia Military Institute before World War I.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
